channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Potholes along a big stretch of road, 14th February
item.description:
So many potholes so close together. All the ridiculous patching of previous potholes is coming out and the road surface is very uneven. Coming off the double bend is so dangerous as people are swerving to avoid them. Accident and car damage waiting to happen!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Old Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loads of big and deep potholes, 14th February
item.description:
Large dangerous potholes along the whole of the street. It’s shocking it’s been allowed to get that bad. Accident waiting to happen.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 116 Horsefair Street, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge deep square pothole, 14th February
item.description:
This pothole has been there for about 2 weeks. It’s massive and has the potential to either cause an accident or do serious damage to a vehicle.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Acomb Crescent, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 14th February
item.description:
Pothole in the middle of the left hand side of the road in Innsworth Lane
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Devereaux Court Innsworth Lane, Churchdown

item.title: Several large potholes, 14th February
item.description:
Several large pot holes in this area. They are getting bigger each day.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Box Trees Cheltenham Road East, Gloucester

item.title: Miss leading pedestrian light, 14th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Pear Tree Cottage Old Gloucester Road, Staverton

Potholes x 3

Lots of damage to the road, including several pot holes.

item.title: Sinking man hole, 14th February
item.description:
Man hole is starting to sink, creating a pot hole around it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 16 Gloucester Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Fly tip of White boarding on side of the Road, 14th February
item.description:
The location is on the Cleeve Common road on the LEFT hand side near a style that goes into the Bill Smiley Butterfly reserve. White boards have been thrown well into the side of the road - so when near the spot please look carefully for them but they can be seen from the road. Please can these be cleared up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cleeve Common, Whittington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked water storm drain, 14th February
item.description:
Drain almost entirely blocked with leaves/branches/rubbish debris which puts the road at risk of flooding in heavy rain. There are several in this state along Christ church road and surrounding area

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 Christ Church Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole repair sub standard, 13th February
item.description:
Pothole has been repaired but contractor had done sub standard job which will lead to rapid deterioration

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 Cleeve View Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large potholes, 13th February
item.description:
I reported this on Friday I have a had an email to say job is complete when it isn't the lads have been today and done the potholes that had spray paint around them but not these ones also there is loads of smaller holes by the ones that have been done today why don't they get done at the same time ?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 22 Vertican Road, Innsworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous Street lights not working, 13th February
item.description:
Numerous Street lights not working since the road was dug up recently for the new Fibre cables...
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Manor Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gang grafitti, 13th February
item.description:
'Crasher' tag on wall. The same tag is written on the bridge on Poole way and various other places around St Paul's.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 8 Saint Paul's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars parking on pavements, blocking dropped curbs, 13th February
item.description:
Three cars constantly park on the pavement, blocking pavements and dropped curbs on both sides of the road for wheelchairs/prams/partially sighted users. Wardens patrol regularly, but these never seem to get a ticket, even though they are parked on the pavement where double yellow lines are on the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 47 Swindon Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sinkhole and potholes, 13th February
item.description:
Sinkhole has had a barrier around it for over eight months, taking up a parking space (for which we pay a permit). Potholes in the road next to it are worsening too.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 12 Granville Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burned out, 13th February
item.description:
Vehicle burned out in bushes on a public right of way

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Coberley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Filthy pavements,litter,overgrown pavement, 13th February
item.description:
Visiting this neighbourhood and it’s an absolute disgrace The pavements are covered in rubbish,leaves and full dog bags hanging in trees
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 5 May Trees Lansdown Crescent, Cheltenham
